definitions: The act of completely dismantling or taking something apart.
A building, especially a house, that is purchased primarily for the value of the land it sits on, with the intention of demolishing it to build a new structure.
A detailed analysis or deconstruction of a product or system.
examples: The mechanic performed a complete engine teardown.
They bought a small teardown in a wealthy neighborhood.
The website published a teardown of the new smartphone.
